title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: Reference evapotranspiration (ETo) defined potential water lost evaporation plant transpiration reference surface: reference surface hypothetical grass reference crop assumed crop height 0.12 m, fixed surface resistance 70 s m-1 albedo 0.23. reference surface closely resembles extensive surface green, well-watered grass uniform height, actively growing completely shading ground. fixed surface resistance 70 s m-1 implies moderately dry soil surface resulting weekly irrigation frequency.3 calculate ETo, use Food Agriculture Organization’s Penman-Monteith ETo algorithm. method allows ETo calculated using daily meteorological observations. method, daily ETo calculated : \[ ET_o = \frac{0.408 \Delta (R_n - G) + \gamma \frac{900}{T + 273} u_2 (e_s - e_a)}{\Delta + \gamma (1 + 0.34 u_2)} \] : \(ET_o\) reference surface evapotranspiration (mm/day) \(R_n\) net radiation crop surface (MJ/m2/day) \(G\) soil heat flux (MJ/m2/day) \(T\) average temperature (°C) \(u_2\) wind speed 2 meters height (m/s) \(e_s\) saturation vapor pressure (kPa) \(e_a\) actual vapor pressure (kPa) \(\Delta\) slope vapor pressure curve (kPa/°C) \(\gamma\) psychrometric constant (kPa/°C)

title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: steps derive intermediate variables necessary calculate ETo outlined following sections. following input data used examples: Example meteorological data measured 6 July Uccle (Brussels, Belgium)4.

title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: daily average temperature derived Tmin Tmax: \[ T_{mean} = \frac{T_{max} + T_{min}}{2} \] Plugging numbers example, get: \[ T_{mean} =  \frac{21.5 + 12.3}{2} = 16.9°C \]

what: Step 2: Convert Solar Radiation to Units of MJ m-2 day-1
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: One watt per square meter equal one joule per meter squared per second. Therefore, convert daily incoming shortwave radiation multiplying number seconds day (3600 * 24), converting joules megajoules (multiply 1e-6): \[ R_s [MJ m^{-2} day^{-1}] = R_s [W m^{2}] * 3600 * 24 * 1e-6 \] Using example, get: \[ R_s [MJ m^{-2} day^{-1}] = 255.4398 * 3600 * 24 * 1e-6 = 22.07 [MJ m^{-2} day^{-1}] \] ETo provides wm2_to_mj() function, calculation user.

what: Step 3: Adjust Wind Speed Based on Height of Observation
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: Penman-Monteith method requires wind speed measured 2 meters ground surface ETo calculation. wind speeds measured taller heights tend larger 2-meter wind speeds, need adjust observations using following equation: \[ u_2 = u_2 * \frac{4.87}{log(67.8 * observation\_height - 5.42)} \] Using example: \[ u_2 = 2.7778 * \frac{4.87}{log(67.8 * 10 - 5.42)} = 2.0777 \] ETo provides adjust_wind_speed() function, calculation user.

what: Step 4: Calculate the Slope of the Saturation Vapor Pressure Curve (\(\Delta\))
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: saturation vapor pressure air changes temperature. slope relationship represents effectively moisture can wicked plant soil surface air. turn affects rate ETo. \(\Delta\) defined follows: \[ \Delta = \frac{4098 * [0.6108 * exp(\frac{17.27 * T_{mean}}{T_{mean} + 237.3})]}{(T_{mean} + 237.3)^2} \] Using example, get: \[ \Delta = \frac{4098 * [0.6108 * exp(\frac{17.27 * 16.9}{16.9 + 237.3})]}{(16.9 + 237.3)^2} = 0.122 \] ETo provides calc_svp_slope() function, calculation user.

title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: Atmospheric pressure effect much ET can occur. lower pressures ET increases slightly, due less force exerted earth’s surface5. absence measured pressure data, can estimated using elevation: \[ P = 101.3 * [\frac{293 - 0.0065*z}{293}]^5.26 \] Using example, get: \[ P = 101.3 * [\frac{293 - 0.0065*100}{293}]^5.26 = 100.124 \] ETo provides calc_pressure() function, calculation user.

title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: Zotarelli et al (2010) explain \(\gamma\) relating “partial pressure water air air temperature vapor pressure can estimated using paired dry wet thermometer bulb temperature readings. Another way describe psychrometric constant ratio specific heat moist air constant pressure latent heat vaporization. calculated : \[ \gamma = \frac{C_p*P}{\epsilon * \lambda} = 0.000665 * P \] : \(\gamma\) psychrometric constant, kPa °C-1. \(C_p\) specific heat constant pressure, 1.013 10-3, MJ kg-1 °C-1. \(P\) atmospheric pressure, kPa. \(\epsilon\) ratio molecular weight water vapor dry air, 0.622. \(\lambda\) latent heat vaporization, 2.45, MJ kg-1 Using example: \[ \gamma = \frac{C_p*100.1235083}{\epsilon * \lambda} = 0.067 \] ETo provides calc_psychrometric_constant() function, calculation user.

what: Step 10: Calculate the Mean Saturation Vapor Pressure
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: described step 4, saturation vapor pressure related air temperature. given temperature, saturation vapor pressure can calculated : \[ e_{(t)} = 0.6108 * exp[\frac{17.27 * T}{T + 237.3}] \] : \(e_{(t)}\) saturation vapor pressure given temperature (kPa). \(T\) air temperature (°C). daily minimum maximum temperature available, daily average saturation vapor pressure calculated mean \(e_{(T_{min})}\) \(e_{(T_{max})}\). Otherwise, \(e_{(T_{avg})}\) can used. Using example, means \(e_s\) calculated : \[ e_s = \frac{e_{(T_{min})} + e_{(T_{max})}}{2} \] Using example, get: \[ e_s = \frac{1.431 + 2.564}{2} = 1.997 \] ETo provides calc_sat_vapor_pressure() function, calculation user.

what: Step 11: Calculate the Actual Vapor Pressure (\(e_a\))
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: actual vapor pressure can calculated using \(e_s\) daily \(RH_{min}\) \(RH_{max}\) values: \[ e_a = \frac{e_{(T_{min})} * [\frac{RH_{max}}{100}] + e_{(T_{max})} * [\frac{RH_{min}}{100}]}{2} \] absence daily \(RH_{min}\) \(RH_{max}\) observations, \(e_a\) can calculated using daily mean \(RH\): \[ e_a = \frac{RH_{mean}}{100} * e_s \] Since \(RH_{min}\) \(RH_{max}\), can calculate \(e_a\) : \[ e_a = \frac{1.431 * 0.84 + 3 * 0.63}{2} = 1.409 \] ETo provides calc_act_vapor_pressure() function, calculation user.

what: Step 12: Calculate the Inverse Relative Earth-Sun Distance and the Solar Declination
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: variables, along calculated next steps, required model solar energy reaching earth’s atmosphere. inverse relative distance earth sun (\(d_r\)) solar declination (angle sun sky; \(\delta\)) given : \[ d_r = 1 + 0.033 * cos[\frac{2 * \pi}{365} * J] \] \[ \delta = 0.409 * sin[\frac{2*\pi}{365} * J - 1.39] \] : J julian day (day year) ranging 1 365 (366 leap years). Using example, calculate \(d_r\) \(\delta\) : \[ d_r = 1 + 0.033 * cos[\frac{2 * \pi}{365} * 187] = 0.967099 \] \[ \delta = 0.409 * sin[\frac{2*\pi}{365} * 187 - 1.39] = 0.3954358 \] ETo provides calc_solar_declination() calc_inverse_relative_distance() functions, calculations user.

what: Step 13: Convert Latitude (\(\phi\)) from Decimal Degrees to Radians
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: compatible variables just created, latitude must units radians: \[ \phi [rad] = \frac{\pi}{180} * \phi [decimal\ degrees] \] example, gives us: \[ \phi [rad] = \frac{\pi}{180} * 50.8 = 0.887 \] ETo provides lat_to_radians() function, calculation user.

what: Step 14: Calculate the Sunset Hour Angle (\(\omega_s\))
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: sunset hour angle calculated using latitude declination: \[ \omega_s = arccos[-tan(\phi) * tan(\delta)] \] example: \[ \omega_s = arccos[-tan(0.887) * tan(0.395)] = 2.108 \] ETo provides calc_sunset_hour_angle() function, calculation user.

title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: extraterrestrial radiation amount radiation hits earth’s atmosphere varies time year latitude. calculated : \[ R_a = \frac{24 * 60}{\pi}*G_{sc}*d_r*[(\omega_s * sin(\phi)*sin(\delta)) + (cos(\phi) * cos(\delta) * sin(\omega_s))] \] : \(R_a\) extraterrestrial radiation (MJ M-2 day-1) \(G_{sc}\) solar constant 0.082 MJ M-2 min-1 Using example, gives: \[ \begin{multline} R_a = \\ \frac{24 * 60}{\pi}*G_{sc}*0.967*[(2.108 * sin(0.887)*sin(0.395)) + (cos(0.887) * cos(0.395) * sin(2.108))] = \\ 41.088 \end{multline} \] ETo provides calc_extraterrestrial_rad() function, calculation user.

what: Step 16: Calculate Clear Sky Solar Radiation (\(R_{so}\))
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: extraterrestrial radiation calculated previous step can scaled radiation received Earth’s surface clear sky: \[ R_{} = (0.75 + 2e10^{-5}*z)*R_a \] z elevation sea level meters. Using example: \[ R_{} = (0.75 + 2e10^{-5}*100)*41.088 = 30.898 \] ETo provides calc_clear_sky_radiation() function, calculation user.

what: Step 17: Calculate Net Shortwave Solar Radiation (\(R_{ns}\))
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: net solar radiation calculated using daily incoming shortwave radiation calculated step 2: \[ R_{ns} = (1-\alpha)*R_s \] : \(R_{ns}\) net incoming shortwave radiation (MJ M-2 day-1). \(\alpha\) crop surface albedo. defaults 0.23, can adjusted reference argument. \(R_s\) incoming shortwave solar radiation (MJ M-2 day-1) example: \[ R_{ns} = (1-0.23)*22.07 \] ETo provides calc_shortwave_raidation() function, calculation user.

what: Step 18: Calculate Net Outgoing Longwave Solar Radiation (\(R_{nl}\))
title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: Stefan-Boltzmann law states radiation leaving earth’s surface proportional temperature raised fourth power. , define \(R_{nl}\) follows: \[ R_{nl} = \sigma*[\frac{(T_{max}+273.16)^4 + (T_{min}+273.16)^4}{2}] * (0.34 - 0.14*\sqrt{e_a}) * (1.35 * \frac{R_s}{R_{}}-0.35)) \] : \(R_{nl}\) net outgoing longwave radiation (MJ M-2 day-1). \(\sigma\) Stefan-Boltzmann constant (4.903 * 10-9; MJ K-4 M-2 day-1) Using example, get: \[ R_{nl} = \sigma*[\frac{(21.5+273.16)^4 + (12.3+273.16)^4}{2}] * (0.34 - 0.14*\sqrt{1.409}) * (1.35 * \frac{16.994}{30.898}-0.35)) \] \[ = 3.712 \] Note \(T_{mean}\) temperature data available, \((T_{mean} + 273.16)^4\) can used place \(T_{min}\) \(T_{max}\) bracketed portion equation. ETo provides calc_longwave_radiation() function, calculation user.

title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: Net radiation simply difference betwen incoming shortwave radiation outgoing longwave radiation: \[ R_n = R_{ns} - R_{nl} \] \(R_n\) units MJ M-2 day-1. Using example: \[ R_n = 16.994 - 3.712 = 13.282 \] ETo provides calc_net_radiation() function, calculation user.

title: Calculating Daily Penman-Monteith Reference ET
text: Now components needed calculate ETo. Recall equation calculating ETo \[ ET_o = \frac{0.408 \Delta (R_n - G) + \gamma \frac{900}{T + 273} u_2 (e_s - e_a)}{\Delta + \gamma (1 + 0.34 u_2)} \] calculated soil heat flux (\(G\)), assumed zero daily time step. Finally, plugging values example: \[ ET_o = \frac{0.408 * 0.122  * (13.282 - 0) + 0.067 * \frac{900}{16.9 + 273} * 2.078 * (1.997 - 1.409)}{0.122 + 0.067 * (1 + 0.34 * 2.078)} = 3.88 \] gives \(ET_o\) millimeters. Luckily, don’t steps want calculate \(ET_o\)! ETo provides etr_penman_monteith() function calculations hood.

code: @Manual{,   title = {ETo: Daily Calculation of Reference ET},   author = {Colin Brust},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://mt-climate-office.github.io/ETo/}, }

title: Daily Calculation of Reference ET
text: ETo provides basic utility functions calculating point-based spatial daily reference ET. many R packages calculate reference ET (like Evapotranspiration bigleaf), many provide monthly ET models, none found support raster inputs ---box. ETo provides simple interface calculating daily reference ET works terra::rast data ---box. Currently, Penman-Monteith (FAO-56 model) Hargreaves methods implemented. Functions also provided calculate necessary intermediate variables calculating ETo. input variables needed calculate ETo daily average temperature, min temperature max temperature (Hargreaves), daily average temperature, relative humidity, solar radiation windspeed (Penman-Monteith).

title: Daily Calculation of Reference ET
text: can install development version ETo GitHub :

title: Daily Calculation of Reference ET
text: , reference ET calculated using example dataset given FAO-56 documentation: also works vectors: works terra::rast rasters!
code: library(ETo)  etr_penman_monteith(   t_max = 21.5, # Daily maximum temperature in degC   t_min = 12.3, # Daily minimum temperature in degC   rh_max = 84, # Daily maximum relative humidity (%)   rh_min = 63, # Daily minimum relative humidity (%)   srad = 255.4398, # The incoming shortwave radiation in W m^-2   ws = 2.77778, # Wind speed in meters/second   lat = 50.8, # Latitude of observation in decimal degrees   days = 187, # The day of the year   wind_height = 10, # The height in meters of the wind speed observation   elev = 100, # The elevation of the observations in meters. ) #> [1] 3.88004 etr_penman_monteith(   t_max = c(21.5, 23), # Daily maximum temperature in degC   t_min = c(12.3, 15), # Daily minimum temperature in degC   rh_max = c(84, 80), # Daily maximum relative humidity (%)   rh_min = c(63, 50), # Daily minimum relative humidity (%)   srad = c(255.4398, 325), # The incoming shortwave radiation in W m^-2   ws = c(2.77778, 3), # Wind speed in meters/second   lat = 50.8, # Latitude of observation in decimal degrees   days = c(187, 188), # The day of the year   wind_height = 10, # The height in meters of the wind speed observation   elev = 100, # The elevation of the observations in meters. ) #> [1] 3.880040 5.120389 r <- etr_penman_monteith(   t_max = terra::rast(vals=c(21.5, 23), nrows=1, ncols=2), # Daily maximum temperature in degC   t_min = terra::rast(vals=c(12.3, 15), nrows=1, ncols=2), # Daily minimum temperature in degC   rh_max = terra::rast(vals=c(84, 80), nrows=1, ncols=2), # Daily maximum relative humidity (%)   rh_min = terra::rast(vals=c(63, 50), nrows=1, ncols=2), # Daily minimum relative humidity (%)   srad = terra::rast(vals=c(255.4398, 325), nrows=1, ncols=2), # The incoming shortwave radiation in W m^-2   ws = terra::rast(vals=c(2.77778, 3), nrows=1, ncols=2), # Wind speed in meters/second   lat = 50.8, # Latitude of observation in decimal degrees   days = terra::rast(vals=c(187, 188), nrows=1, ncols=2), # The day of the year   wind_height = 10, # The height in meters of the wind speed observation   elev = 100, # The elevation of the observations in meters. )  terra::plot(r)

what: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
text: Assumes inputs share resolution, extent, projection. Also assumes rasters number layers layer corresponding day. hargreaves, t_mean, t_min t_max required arguments. PM, t_mean, srad, rh, ws must supplied.

title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
code: calc_etr_spatial(   t_mean = NULL,   t_min = NULL,   t_max = NULL,   srad = NULL,   rh = NULL,   rh_min = NULL,   rh_max = NULL,   ws = NULL,   elev = NULL,   days = NULL,   reference = 0.23,   z = 9,   wind_height = 2,   method = "penman" )

title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
text: t_mean multilayer timeseries terra::rast mean daily temperature degrees C. t_min multilayer timeseries terra::rast max daily temperature degrees C. t_max multilayer timeseries terra::rast min daily temperature degrees C. srad multilayer timeseries terra::rast daily solar radiation W m^-2. rh multilayer timeseries terra::rast mean daily relative humidity (%). rh_min multilayer timeseries terra::rast minimum daily relative humidity (%; defaults NULL). rh_max multilayer timeseries terra::rast maximum daily relative humidity (%). ws multilayer timeseries terra::rast mean daily wind speed 2m height m s^-1. elev terra::rast elevation meters. left blank, elevation derived using elevatr package. days multilayer timeseries terra::rast day constant value Julian day. left blank, assumed t_mean input time attribute raster derived using terra::time. reference albedo reference surface ranging 0 - 1. Defaults 0.23 grass. z zoom level download elevation data ranging 1 - 14. One coarser resolution, 14 finer resolution. information, look ?elevatr::get_elev_raster wind_height height wind observation meters. (defaults 2). 2 meters, wind speed corrected 2 meter observation. method method calculate ETo. Can either "penman" "hargreaves".

title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
text: terra::rast timeseries ETo input domain.

title: Calculate a timeseries of ETo across a set of input rasters. — calc_etr_spatial
code: if (FALSE) { # Load data. Need to read with terra::rast to unpack to a raster. srad <- terra::rast(srad) |> terra::subset(1:10) t_mean <- terra::rast(t_mean) |> terra::subset(1:10) # Convert from K to C t_mean <- t_mean - 273.15 t_max <- terra::rast(t_max) |> terra::subset(1:10) # Convert from K to C t_max <- t_max - 273.15 t_min <- terra::rast(t_min) |> terra::subset(1:10) # Convert from K to C t_min <- t_min - 273.15 rh <- terra::rast(rh) |> terra::subset(1:10) ws <- terra::rast(ws) |> terra::subset(1:10)  penman <- calc_etr_spatial(   t_mean = t_mean, srad = srad, rh = rh, ws = ws,   method = "penman", reference = 0.23, z = 3 ) hargreaves <- calc_etr_spatial(   t_mean = t_mean, t_max = t_max, t_min = t_min, method = "hargreaves", z = 3 ) }

what:
Calculate daily total reference ET at a given point. Follows the steps outlined
in Zotarelli et al (2010) https://unpkg.com/node-red-contrib-evapotranspiration@1.0.1/alogorithms/evapotranspiration%20ae45900.pdf. — etr_penman_monteith
title:
Calculate daily total reference ET at a given point. Follows the steps outlined
in Zotarelli et al (2010) https://unpkg.com/node-red-contrib-evapotranspiration@1.0.1/alogorithms/evapotranspiration%20ae45900.pdf. — etr_penman_monteith
text: Calculate daily total reference ET given point. Follows steps outlined Zotarelli et al (2010) https://unpkg.com/node-red-contrib-evapotranspiration@1.0.1/alogorithms/evapotranspiration%20ae45900.pdf.

title:
Calculate daily total reference ET at a given point. Follows the steps outlined

code: etr_penman_monteith(   lat,   days,   srad,   ws,   elev,   rh_mean = NULL,   rh_min = NULL,   rh_max = NULL,   t_mean = NULL,   t_min = NULL,   t_max = NULL,   reference = 0.23,   wind_height = 2 )

title:
Calculate daily total reference ET at a given point. Follows the steps outlined
in Zotarelli et al (2010) https://unpkg.com/node-red-contrib-evapotranspiration@1.0.1/alogorithms/evapotranspiration%20ae45900.pdf. — etr_penman_monteith
text: lat Latitude ETo calculation degrees. days julian day ETo calculated . srad Shortwave radiation W m^-2. ws Wind speed 2 meters M s^-1. elev Elevation meters. rh_mean Relative humidity (%). rh_min Minumum daily relative humidity (%). rh_max Maximum daily relative humidity (%). t_mean Air temperature Celsius. t_min Minimum daily air temperature degC. t_max Maximum daily air temperature degC. reference albedo reference surface (defaults 0.23 grass). wind_height height wind observation meters. (defaults 2). 2 meters, wind speed corrected 2 meter observation.

title:
Calculate daily total reference ET at a given point. Follows the steps outlined
in Zotarelli et al (2010) https://unpkg.com/node-red-contrib-evapotranspiration@1.0.1/alogorithms/evapotranspiration%20ae45900.pdf. — etr_penman_monteith
text: Reference ET mm per day.

title:
Calculate daily total reference ET at a given point. Follows the steps outlined
in Zotarelli et al (2010) https://unpkg.com/node-red-contrib-evapotranspiration@1.0.1/alogorithms/evapotranspiration%20ae45900.pdf. — etr_penman_monteith
code: etr_penman_monteith(   t_mean = NULL,   t_max = 21.5,   t_min = 12.3,   rh_mean = NULL,   rh_max = 84,   rh_min = 63,   lat = 50.8,   days = 187,   ws = 2.77778,   wind_height = 10,   elev = 100,   reference = 0.23,   srad = 255.4398 ) #> [1] 3.88004
